example.name: basic transitive
example.text: Loews Corp makes Kent cigarettes.

example.name: passive, source as of-phrase
example.text: [Those chips]-1 are made *trace*-1 of gallium arsenide.

example.name: mincemeat pie
example.text: But the surprisingly durable seven-year economic expansion has made mincemeat of more than one forecast.
example.arg: the surprisingly durable seven-year economic expansion

example.name: make a deal
example.text: Well , they have made deals with Likud before .

example.name: verbal small clause
example.text: Mary made John clean his room

example.name: nominal small clause
example.text: Financial problems make them unattractive takeover targets.

example.name: adjectival small clause
example.text: Asian nations' memories make them fearful of Japanese economic hegemony.
example.arg: them fearful of Japanese economic hegemony

example.name: with tough-movement
example.text: SC Law makes it a crime to breach test security.
example.arg: it a crime to breach test security

example.name: cause to be
example.text: For Zel Herring, owner and a cook at the Sandhills Luncheon Cafe, a tin building in midtown, all this has made for a very good year.
example.arg: For Zel Herring, owner and a cook at the Sandhills Luncheon Cafe, a tin building in midtown
example.note: Please note how this is different from make.06, be seem. "all this" is really causing the "very good year", not seeming like one.

example.name: make sure
example.text: We will do everything we-1 can *PRO*-1 to make sure that he shows up at his court date there .
example.arg: sure that he shows up at his court date there.

roleset.name: bid or purchase or whatever: PLACEHOLDER SENSE-- DO NOT SELECT

roles.note: *This sense is obsolete for our purposes-- both "make a bid" and "make a purchase" are light verb constructions, and should be tagged with .LV. See the following examples for instructions on .LV annotation.

example.name: THIS SHOULD BE MARKED .LV!
example.text: Edison made refunds to its customers.
example.arg: argm-PRX: refunds to its customers (tag the parent node, sister node to the rel)
argm-PRR: refunds (tag the word itself, not a parent node)

example.name: THIS SHOULD BE MARKED .LV
example.text: Fujitsu made a similar bid to win a contract.
example.arg: argm-PRX: a similar bid (tag the parent node, sister node to the rel)
argm-PRR: bid (tag the word itself, not a parent node)

roleset.name: true light verb-- PLACEHOLDER SENSE-- DO NOT SELECT

roles.note: *Don't selec this-- rather, select .LV. Also, don't pay attention to this argument structure-- see examples for .03 and .04 for proper .LV annotation.

example.name: MARK AS .LV!
example.text: The department will make payment for bills maturing on Nov. 2 to all investors who have requested reinvestment of their bills on that date, as well as to all account holders who have previously requested payment.
example.arg: argm-PRX: payment for bills maturing on Nov. 2to all investors who [*T*-1] have requested reinvestment of their bills on that date , as well as to all account holders who [*T*-2] have previously requested payment (tag parent node, sister node to rel)
argm-PRR: payment (tag word itself, not a parent node)
example.note: Don't tag argMs with .LV! Tag only arg0, argm-PRX, argm-PRR, and any * or & links that are needed (but not argm-SLC).

example.name: make a quick buck
example.text: If Bill Gates made a nickel every time Windows crashed...oh wait, he does.

example.name: job as for-phrase
example.text: Judy Rodin makes way too much money for what she does.

example.name: job as as-phrase
example.text: Judy Rodin makes way too much money as Penn's president.

example.name: take that, eh?
example.text: Americans make better fishermen.
*PRO*-2 Overcome *-1 by hunger pains Sellers-2 would eat massive amounts of food and then throw it up *PRO*-2 to make weight.
Some other stories making headlines right now.
We made the finish line!

example.name: passivized
example.text: [40% of the homeless population]-1 is made *trace*-1 up of women and children.

example.name: corresponding active
example.text: Women and children make up 40% of the homeless population

example.name: basic transitive
example.text: *trace* Make up your own mind on the issue.

example.name: intransitive, compound subject
example.text: After fighting for a week, John and Mary finally kissed and made up.

example.name: split actors
example.text: John finally made up with Mary.

example.name: transitive
example.text: John made up all the answers on his midterm.

role.descr: entity which is behind in something (eg payments)

example.name: bad student
example.text: John will have to make up the midterm at some later date.

example.name: instrumental agent
example.text: Some Democrats, led by Rep. Jack Brooks (D., Texas), unsuccessfully opposed the measure because they fear that the fees may not fully make up for the budget cuts.

roles.note: (I haven't actually seen any of these in WSJ, but who knows?)

example.name: typical usage?
example.text: I can't make out the handwriting on this letter.

example.name: Imperative
example.text: Please *PRO* make out the check to "AT & T"

example.name: getting by
example.text: At his new job, as partner in charge of federal litigation in the Sacramento office of Orrick, Herrington & Sutcliffe, he will make out much better.
example.arg: At his new job, as partner in charge of federal litigation in the Sacramento office of Orrick, Herrington & Sutcliffe,

example.name: without destination
example.text: The governor couldn't make it, so the lieutenant governor welcomed the special guests.

example.name: with destination
example.text: John-1 couldn't be bothered *trace*-1 to make it to his own funeral.

example.name: if I can make it there, I'll make it anywhere
example.text: Mike Huber, a roustabout, is even making it in his new career as an entrepreneur.
example.arg: in his new career as an entrepreneur

example.name: bank robbers
example.text: When he initially refused, he says, they stabbed him in the back and made off with $2,000 and 280 blank tickets.
example.note: *remember not to tag PRN nodes (containing things like "he says")

frameset.note: Frames file for 'make' based on initial sample of sentences from big corpus. Revised by Olga.
